entry.title: Combined summary - Re: The Cat, BIP draft discussion.
entry.summary: The discussion centers on the handling of Bitcoin Stamps outputs and the outputs marked by Ord as part of the Bitcoin network's UTXO (Unspent Transaction Output) set. The crux of the argument is that while Bitcoin Stamps outputs, being unspendable, are logically excluded from the UTXO set without controversy or need for a formal BIP (Bitcoin Improvement Proposal), the treatment of Ord-marked outputs—associated with witness Inscriptions and inherently spendable—poses a more complex issue. The proposal under consideration suggests avoiding direct confiscation of these spendable assets, which would conflict with Bitcoin's foundational principles, by instead implementing a transaction validation rule. This rule would mandate that any transaction containing sats associated with an Ordinal Inscription must have fewer outputs than inputs if any input is less than 1,000 sats, thereby indirectly reducing the UTXO set size over time without outright seizing bitcoins. Further elaboration on this topic highlights that the exclusion of provably unspendable outputs from the UTXO set is a longstanding practice within Bitcoin core implementations, aimed at efficiency and simplicity in network operations. It's noted that such exclusions, which include outputs larger than 10kb and those prefixed with OP_RETURN, do not necessitate consensus changes or BIPs because they pertain to implementation details rather than protocol-level adjustments. These practices are part of broader efforts to maintain the operability and scalability of the Bitcoin network by managing the size and composition of the UTXO set in ways that align with the network's decentralized and permissionless ethos.
